revision.text:
{{Infobox weapon |name= MDT David |image= [[File:David-1.jpg|border|300px]] |caption= A MDT David |origin= [[United Kingdom]]/[[Israel]] |type= Ultra light armored personnel carrier, [[Armored car (military)|light Armored Vehicle]] |is_ranged= |is_bladed= |is_explosive= |is_artillery= |is_vehicle=yes |is_missile= |is_UK= |service= 2007–present |primary users |wars= |designer= |design_date= |manufacturer= |unit_cost= |production_date= 2006–present |body_style(s)= 3-door |assembly= MDT Armor Corporation |number= |variants= |spec_label= |weight= ''Land Rover Defender 110'': {{convert|3800|kg|lb|0|abbr=on}},
''Toyota Land Cruiser LC79'': {{convert|4700|kg|lb|0|abbr=on}} (Gross weight){{cite web | url=http://www.mdt-armor.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/MDT_David_Brochure_LR.pdf | title=MDT David brochure | publisher=MDT Armor Corporation | accessdate=13 April 2015}} |length= ''Land Rover Defender 110'': {{convert|4470|mm|ft|0|abbr=on}},
''Toyota Land Cruiser LC79'': {{convert|5040|mm|ft|0|abbr=on}} |part_length= |width= ''Land Rover Defender 110'': {{convert|1790|mm|ft|0|abbr=on}},
''Toyota Land Cruiser LC79'': {{convert|1972|mm|ft|0|abbr=on}} |height= ''Land Rover Defender 110'': {{convert|2035|mm|ft|0|abbr=on}},
''Toyota Land Cruiser LC79'': {{convert|2227|mm|ft|0|abbr=on}} |diameter= |crew= 4 – 6 |armour= |primary_armament= |secondary_armament= |engine= Turbocharged inter-cooled diesel engine |engine_power = Land Rover Defender 110: 122 bhp (90kW) @ 3500 rpm,
Toyota Land Cruiser LC79: 129 bhp (96kW) @ 3,800rpm |pw_ratio= |transmission= Manual, 5/6 forward |payload_capacity= |suspension=Permanent 4 wheel drive, Part time 4X4 |clearance= |fuel_capacity= |vehicle_range= |speed= |guidance= |steering= }} The '''MDT David''' is an ultra light armored personnel carrier and [[Armored car (military)|light Armored Vehicle]] assembled by MDT Armor Corporation for the [[Israeli Security Forces]]. The vehicle is based on [[Land Rover Defender]] and [[Toyota Land Cruiser]] platforms and replaces the [[AIL Storm]]. It is designed to provide protection in [[low intensity conflict]]. It is capable of resistance from [[assault rifle]] fire, blast from floor and roof, and limited protection against [[Improvised Explosive Device]]s.{{cite web | url=http://www.defense-update.com/products/d/david.htm | title=David – Light Armored Combat Vehicle | accessdate=14 April 2015}} The David has a 4 cylinder, turbocharged inter-cooled diesel engine. It can accommodate 4–6 fully armed people with three doors, roof hatch and 4–6 windows.{{cite web | url=http://www.mdt-armor.com/armored-vehicles-military-law-enforcment/land-rover-basedfamily/david/ | title=The David | publisher=MDT Armor Corporation| accessdate=14 April 2015}} == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == {{Commons}} * [http://www.mdt-armor.com//armored-vehicles-military-law-enforcment/land-rover-basedfamily/david/ MDT David] * [http://www.marketwired.com/press-release/arotech-and-israel-military-industries-ltd-imi-to-jointly-market-the-david-nasdaq-artx-1201764.htm Arotech and Israel Military Industries Ltd (IMI) to Jointly Market the David] [[Category:Military vehicles of Israel]] [[Category:2000s automobiles]] [[Category:Off-road vehicles]] [[Category:All-wheel-drive vehicles]] [[Category:Jeep platforms]] [[Category:Armoured cars of Israel]] [[Category:Compact sport utility vehicles]] {{Modern-auto-stub}}
